image.altText: a large ferry with red livery in the sea.

props.synopsis: One of the brand new Spirit of Tasmania ships will be relocated to a shipyard in Scotland for an unknown amount of time while the ferry operator explores options to lease it out because its berth is not ready in Tasmania.

title.children: New Spirit of Tasmania ferry to be relocated to Scotland

image.altText: A child brushes their teeth while in a bath.

props.synopsis: Tasmania has the worst prevalence of tooth loss out of any state, but children are being denied or delayed free Medicare-funded check-ups because of a shortage of dentists.

title.children: Tasmanian kids turned away from free annual dental check-ups if they're not in pain

image.altText: Two salmon farming enclosures on a waterway.

props.synopsis: A decision on whether to increase the threatened species listing of the Maugean skate, which shares its habitat with salmon-farming operations, won't be made until after next year's federal election.

title.children: Decision on endangered skate put off until after next federal election

image.altText: Brian Mitchell, with Rebecca White and Jen Butler.

props.synopsis: Federal Lyons MP Brian Mitchell declares he's happy to stand aside and let former Tasmanian Labor leader Rebecca White contest the key battleground electorate at next year's federal election.

title.children: Labor MP happy to step aside for 'once in a generation' former state party leader

image.altText: colours and numbers light up a gaming machine

props.synopsis: A gambler's losses while playing electronic gaming machines would have been capped as part of a harm-minimisation system which was soon to be implemented in Tasmania, however advocates say a new statement by the premier is the clearest signal yet the plan will be spiked.

title.children: Advocates say nation-leading pokies reform at risk after Tasmanian Premier flags 'more measured approach'

image.altText: Road works crew at construction site, unspecified location.

props.synopsis: In 2010, three workers were poisoned by toxic gas from an old underground pipe. Now there is a push to do something about the "potentially fatal" risk — but the company that owned the pipes went bust and nobody knows where they are anymore.

title.children: Deadly gas lying in wait in underground pipes beneath two Tasmanian cities

image.altText: A krill processing ship near a surfacing whale.

props.synopsis: At the meeting between 26 member countries, proposals to establish new marine protected areas and revise catch limits for krill are rejected, while existing krill management measures are rolled back. Australia says it's a "backwards step", putting the Antarctic ecosystem at risk.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Russia and China block every proposal at Antarctic marine life conservation conference in Hobart

image.altText: Two women wearing hijabs.

props.synopsis: Haje Nahed Hijazi was about to fall asleep in Sydney when she heard that an Israeli air strike had hit the home her family in Lebanon was taking refuge in.

title.children: Sydney women reveal pain of losing 19 family members in an Israeli air strike

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese Blue Room

props.synopsis: The prime minister says he only remembers limited interactions with former Qantas boss Alan Joyce, and if there are specific claims he made direct calls to ask for free upgrades, "let them be made".

title.children: Dutton says Albanese should refer himself for corruption investigation over Qantas upgrades

image.altText: A composite image of Mark Haines with railway tracks.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into a teenager's 1988 death has heard claims his then girlfriend "fears for her life" because of what she knows.

title.children: Witness tells inquest woman 'knows what happened' to Mark Haines before his body was found on train tracks

image.altText: College at twilight.

props.synopsis: Multiple students have been expelled and suspended following what is being described as a "serious humiliation" incident at St Paul's College at the University of Sydney last week.

title.children: Six students expelled from Sydney college after 'serious humiliation of another student'

image.altText: A car with UN on the bonnet is parked near a guard tower on a wall

props.synopsis: Israeli parliament passes legislation that could threaten the work of the main UN agency providing aid to people in Gaza by barring it from operating on Israeli soil.

title.children: Israel passes legislation banning UNRWA from Israeli soil

image.altText: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump looking at each other in election illustration

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is facing serious backlash over comments made by opening speakers at his Madison Square Garden rally — here's the latest updates from the US election.

title.children: Trump campaign responds to Puerto Rico backlash as FBI investigates ballot box arson — the latest from the US election campaign trail

image.altText: Two signes outside a shop that read "MYER"

props.synopsis: Department store giant Myer will purchase a slew of fashion chains, giving it ownership of nearly 800 retail stores across Australia and New Zealand.

title.children: Myer buys more than 700 fashion stores, including Just Jeans, Portmans and Jay Jays

image.altText: A picture of two women superimposed together

props.synopsis: A Liberal upper house MP has apologised for reneging on a deal with a colleague ahead of a vote on a bill seeking to reform South Australia's abortion laws, saying she felt pressured by an "external visitor" on the night.

title.children: Liberal MP went into 'panic mode' before voting on abortion law amendments

image.altText: Jamshid Sharmahd wearing a blue face mask and jumpsuit while seated in a courtroom in front of a crowd of blurred supporters

props.synopsis: Iranian-born German citizen Jamshid Sharmahd had been held as a prisoner since 2020, accused of plotting attacks against Iran.

title.children: Germany threatens Iran with 'serious consequences' over dual national prisoner's execution

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a yellow cap and gestures against a stars and stripes background

props.synopsis: It is the first legal action to be brought over the America PAC sweepstakes which offer $US1 million every day until November 5 for people who have signed a petition.

title.children: Philadelphia district attorney sues Elon Musk over $US1m election giveaways

image.altText: A highlighted strip of blue over an aerial photo of Punt Road.

props.synopsis: Michelle McClurg has been wondering for over 15 years if the government was going to knock down her house due to the public acquisition overlay on the area.

title.children: 'You don't have a say': The government mechanism that could cost some home owners dearly

image.altText: Rocket launching in a dry dusty paddock

props.synopsis: The Whalers Way Orbital Launch complex is another step closer to operation as federal Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek gives the green light to the project.

title.children: Environment minister approves South Australian rocket launching facility

image.altText: A man in a suit with a few police officers.

props.synopsis: The Queensland Police Service has confirmed it will exceed its budget for the 2024-2025 financial year due to "rising costs and approved commitments".

title.children: New Queensland premier assures there will be no impact on frontline policing despite budget overspend

image.altText: Displaced Palestinians wait to receive United Nations Relief and Works Agency (UNRWA) aid, in Rafah

props.synopsis: The Coalition suggests redirecting funds from the United Nations aid group working in Gaza after Israel passed laws banning UNRWA operations within its borders.

title.children: Coalition calls for UNRWA funding to be diverted to other aid groups after laws passed to ban group from Israel

image.altText: A photo of Todd Mengaldo in a hoodie kneeling down.

props.synopsis: Police have charged Todd Menegaldo with manslaughter after the death of Seddon man Andrew Truman.

title.children: Police charge man with manslaughter in connection to deadly Melbourne CBD assault

image.altText: A brunette woman stands in the street holding a cup of ice cream. She wears a white tank top and denim skirt.

props.synopsis: Egg freezing is often sold by fertility clinics as an "insurance policy". But some experts say it's more like a lottery, and few women return to use their frozen eggs.

title.children: Freezing eggs is sold as an 'insurance policy', but few women go on to use them

image.altText: Toxic chemical symbols super-imposed on an a photo of a cotton bulb.

props.synopsis: A cotton industry advocate says dryland crops are at risk if the regulator lowers the usage rate of a chemical that has been linked to Parkinson's disease.

title.children: Cotton Australia doesn't want to see the chemical paraquat banned as it would put its industry at risk

image.altText: Singer Chris Martin on stage singing with a microphone in his hand and fans in the background

props.synopsis: Fans desperate to get their hands on Coldplay tickets have been warned to beware of online scams orchestrated by cybercriminals seeking to exploit their fear of missing out.

title.children: Trying to buy last-minute Coldplay tickets? Watch out for online scams

image.altText: A man with a long beard and black robe speaks into a microphone while sitting next to a short desk.

props.synopsis: The nation's peak Jewish body launches legal action against an Islamic preacher and religious centre in Western Sydney over alleged anti-Semitic speeches.

title.children: Jewish organisation takes legal action against Sydney Islamic preacher and religious centre

image.altText: Sean 'Diddy' Combs

props.synopsis: The California plaintiff accuses the music mogul of spiking his drink and forcing him to perform oral sex after the then-10-year-old said he would "do anything" to become a star.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs accused of drugging and sexually assaulting 10-year-old boy during 'audition'

image.altText: An older man in a red shirt standing in front of a tree

props.synopsis: When spraying crops, John O'Brien would end up covered in chemicals including paraquat. He's one of six farmers from Crookwell who say they have been diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease.

title.children: Six farmers grew up in the same tiny town getting 'covered' in chemicals. They all now have Parkinson's

image.altText: Moody image of a person dressed in dark work clothes

props.synopsis: Preliminary results of a global survey show Australia has some of the highest rates of work addiction. Managers, people with a demanding job and those with family members addicted to work are at the highest risk of developing a work addiction.

title.children: A quarter of Australians are addicted to work, preliminary research finds

image.altText: translucent tendrils with shells at the end

props.synopsis: Beachgoers have been left confused by the unusual sight of thousands of tendril-like stalks attached to shells that washed up on a 3-metre column, south of Adelaide.

title.children: Goose barnacles resembling 'udon noodles' surprise beachgoers south of Adelaide

image.altText: the premier looking away from the camera

props.synopsis: David Crisafulli, Queensland's new premier, ran a troubled training organisation when it tried and failed to convince regulators that breaches of compliance rules had been fixed.

title.children: FOI documents reveal federal regulator personally wrote to Queensland's new premier over troubled training organisation

image.altText: Person sitting on a couch working on a laptop

props.synopsis: A tribunal finds a council employee who tripped over a 60-centimetre pet fence during a coffee break while working from home is entitled to workers compensation.

title.children: Council employee who tripped over pet fence while working from home wins compensation claim

image.altText: a woman with a red blazer smiles inside a train station

props.synopsis: Travellers to Japan may have picked up on a familiar accent while riding the Shinkansen between Tokyo and the southern island of Kyushu.

title.children: The Aussie woman behind the English announcements on Japan's busiest bullet trains

image.altText: A man with an arm around a woman standing together in front of an ambulance

props.synopsis: Matilda Campbell made international headlines after becoming stuck in a rock crevice in the Hunter Valley for seven hours. Today, the 23-year-old was reunited with the team who rescued her.

title.children: Rescuers removed 'one rock at a time' to free woman trapped upside down in rock crevice

image.altText: Several trees with snapped trunks in a park

props.synopsis: Glen Eira council is appealing for the community to help identify offenders who cut down, ripped out and killed hundreds of thousands of dollars worth of young trees in parks in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Hundreds of trees vandalised at multiple parks in Melbourne's south-east
